byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Istanbul, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Canakkale, Turkey. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Authorities identify Islamic State member Mehmet Ozturk, as suicide bomber who killed three Israeli citizens and Iranian in Istanbul; attack, fourth similar incident in 2016, points to Turkey's difficulty in fighting insurgents at home and abroad.

headline.print_headline: Istanbul Suicide Bomber Linked to Islamic State
headline.main: Turkish Member of ISIS Carried Out Istanbul Bombing, Official Says

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Mehmet Ozturk was the perpetrator of a suicide bombing that killed four foreigners in Istanbul on Saturday, the Turkish interior minister said.
lead_paragraph: Mehmet Ozturk was the perpetrator of a suicide bombing that killed four foreigners in Istanbul on Saturday, the Turkish interior minister said.
